Meaning of Keara in Celtic origin/culture for Girl name with history and fame details. More About Celtic Name: Keara. Keara is of an English origin and variant of CIARA, which is feminine form of CIAR. Derived from Irish Ciar meaning black. Saint Ciara was an Irish nun who established a monastery at Kilkeary in the 7th century.

Latin Meaning: The name Alera is a Latin baby name. In Latin the meaning of the name Alera is: Eagle. SoulUrge Number: 7. Expression Number: 1. People with this name have a deep inner need for quiet, and a desire to understand and analyze the world they live in, and to learn the deeper truths. People with this name tend to initiate events, to be leaders rather than followers, with powerful personalities.

Last year this name was ranked as one of the top 1000 most popular names within its gender. Keep in mind how popular a name is. Your child may feel that they fit in more with a more popular name. On the other hand, they may feel more special if their name is less popular and more uniquely their own. As you see it can go both ways, so just keep this point in mind as you examine the different possibilities. In the U.S. in 2014, it ranked 9495 in baby name popularity for girls with 11 occurrences. Alecia /ale-cia/ [3 sylls.] as a girls' name. Alecia's name origin is Old German, and the name Alecia means noble, exalted. Alecia is an alternate spelling of Alice (Old German). Alecia is also a derivative of Alicia (Old German). Kreatif forms: Alcia, Alelia. Shown below is the baby name popularity of Alecia for girls. Alecia entered the list in 1960-1969 and reached its apex position of #602 in the U.S. during 1980-1989, but is not in the Top 1000 currently.
